titleStmt.title: Anthony Hain v. King County. Order Granting Writ of Habeas Corpus.

bibl.title: Anthony Hain v. King County. Order Granting Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: Terrority of Washington 3rd Judicial District ss
div1.p: In District court holding terms at Seattle in King County In the matter of the Application of Anthony Hain for a Writ of Habeas Corpus

When reading and filing the petition and complaint Anthony Hain duly signed and verified on his behalf by a compentent person, whereby it appears that he is illegeally imprisioned and restrained of his liberty by L.V. Wyckoff Sheriff of the County of King at the county jail in the County of King in the Terrority of Washington, and stating wherein the alledged illegality, consists, which it appears to me that a Writ of Habeas Corpus ought to issue.

It is indeed that a Writ of Habeas Corpus out of and under the seal of the above named district court directed to the said L.V. Wyckoff, Sheriff as aforesaid commanding him to have the body of the said Anthony Hain before me, at my chambers, in the city of Seattle, King County Washington Terriority, on the 5th day of October 1878, at ten o'clock AM M of that day, to do and recieve what shall then and there be considered concerning the said complainant Anthony Hain, together with the time and cause of his detention and have then and there the said writ.
div1.ab: Seattle, October 4th, 1878 at Chambers J.R. Lewis Judge
Filed Oct 4th 1878 James Jenny clerk James H. Hamm
